data.name: Shuffled N-Ary Tree
data.description:
#  Shuffled N-Ary Tree

## Description
You are given a shuffled array of Node objects. Find the root!

The input array contains all the nodes from one N-ary tree. Each Node of this tree has a unique value.

Implement a function, find_root, that will return the *root* node of the shuffled tree.

You may assume that the input contains all (and only) the nodes from one valid tree.

### N-ary Node Class
```
class Node
  value: int
  children: Node[]
  constructor(value, children)
```

### Example 1:
#### Example Input:
```
[Node(2), Node(4), Node(7), Node(1), Node(3), Node(5), Node(6)]
```
#### Expected Output:
```
Node(1) # as root of tree 
```
#### Visualization of Example 1:
```
         1
      /  |  \ 
    2    3    4
            / | \
          5   6   7
```

### How to make a test case:
Test cases take serialized trees as input.
To serialize an n-ary tree use the following algorithm:
1. breadth-first traversal
2. after the end of each children array, add None
3. truncate any trailing None elements

#### Here is example 1 in serialized form:
```
[1, None, 2, 3, 4, None, None, None, 5, 6, 7]
```

Constraints:

`1 <= number of nodes <= 10^3`

`1 <= node.value <= 10^6`

follow-up: can you do this in O(n) time and O(1) space complexity?
